Rich Kreiner, "Comics and the Man," Comics Journal, no. 267 (April-May 2005), 188-90
Kreiner
267 188 Comics Journal 2005

Eisner wrote, "In our culture, film and comics are the major conveyors of story through imagery, Each employ arranged graphics and text or dialogue. While film and theater have long ago established their credentials, comics still struggle for acceptance, and the art form, after more than ninety years of popular use, is still regarded as a problematic literary vehicle" (Graphic Storytelling and Visual Narrative, 3)
Eisner
